client.name: Marcus Ashford
client.demeanor: Anxious, evasive, appears guilty even to Phoenix
client.background: Successful but ruthless banker who made enemies climbing the corporate ladder

victim.name: Victoria Sterling
victim.cause_of_death: Blunt force trauma to the head

physical_evidence: Marcus's fingerprints on the murder weapon (crystal award)
Security footage showing him entering the building at 11:30 PM
His keycard used to access Victoria's floor at 11:42 PM
motive: Victoria was about to expose Marcus's insider trading scheme
She had evidence that would ruin his career and send him to prison
They had a very public argument earlier that day in the office
Marcus stood to lose $50 million if Victoria's report went public
circumstantial_evidence: Marcus lied about his whereabouts that night initially
He was seen disposing of bloody clothes in a dumpster
His alibi witness (his wife) has since recanted her statement
He attempted to access Victoria's computer remotely after her death

before_murder: Researched Victoria's daily routines and security codes
Purchased cleaning supplies and a new set of clothes
after_murder: Immediately lawyered up and refused to speak to police
Tried to establish a fake alibi with multiple witnesses
Attempted to flee the country before arrest

why_phoenix_took_case: Court-appointed after three other lawyers refused. The case seems absolutely hopeless, but Phoenix believes everyone deserves a defense.
